intro: Richardella campechiana, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in wetlands and along stream banks, often forming dense colonies. Its hairy leaves and fibrous stems are adapted to wet, muddy environments.
